sorry, i typed ubuntu-cn
sorry
i want to ubuntu-cn, but i got mistake
i use aptitude install apache and aptitude install php5, then i open firefox, and typed 127.0.0.1/info.php. then firefox open a windows ask me if want to download info.php
I think that means that your php configuration isn't working correctly.
aha, you need to configure apache to use php. There are some simple guides on the net, but check /etc/apache2/mods-enabled
Then try check /etc/apache2/mods-available
if mods-available lists php, then you can go into mods-enabled and create a symlink to mods-available.
you need to install the apache-php package also I think. I can't remember the name, wait one second whilst I look it up.
HymnToLife that is very strange...
he is asking you which version of Ubuntu you are running :-)
did you install apache or apache2?
ok, I'm confused now :-/
I installed php5 really recently and it was there.
:=) That's good!
now you just need to create a symlink in mods-enabled to the php files in mods-available.
then restart apache2
